meanings.definition: A part of a city, especially a slum area, occupied by a minority group or groups.
meanings.sent1: The ghetto in our town is where many families live close together.
meanings.sent2: The police patrolled the ghetto to ensure everyone's safety.
meanings.sent3: I heard a joke about a cat who moved into the ghetto and made friends with all the dogs.
meanings.sent4: Her cluttered desk looked like a mini ghetto of papers and pens.
meanings.sent5: The smell of delicious food wafted from the ghetto, tempting passersby to stop and eat.

meanings.definition: A section of a city, especially a thickly populated slum area, inhabited predominantly by members of an ethnic or other minority group, often as a result of social or economic restrictions.
meanings.sent1: The old buildings in the ghetto were in need of repair.
meanings.sent2: Many immigrants found refuge in the ghetto when they first arrived in the country.
meanings.sent3: The pigeons seemed to have their own little ghetto on the rooftop, cooing away.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a crowded ghetto of thoughts, all jumbled together.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti-covered walls of the ghetto told stories of resilience and struggle.
